title: Apache Server Version Disclosure in 404 Error Page
description: The application returns Apache's default 404 error page which exposes the server version in the HTML body. When accessing non-existent resources, the error page contains an address footer that explicitly reveals "Apache/2.4.25 (Debian) Server at localhost Port 80". This is the default Apache error page behavior that has not been customized or suppressed. The 404 page is always accessible for any request to a non-existent resource, making this information readily available to anyone probing the server without needing to inspect response headers.
impact: Provides attackers with exact Apache version information through a readily accessible error page. Unlike header-based version disclosure which might be filtered, the 404 error page HTML content is guaranteed to be served. This reconnaissance information can be used to identify known vulnerabilities affecting Apache 2.4.25. Combined with other reconnaissance techniques, attackers can build a detailed profile of server versions and technologies in use. Known CVEs for Apache 2.4.25 (released 2016) can be targeted with precision.
evidence:
HTTP Request: curl -i http://localhost/nonexistent_page.php Response (HTTP 404): Status: 404 Not Found Server: Apache/2.4.25 (Debian) Content-Type: text/html; charset=iso-8859-1 HTML Body: 404 Not Found

Not Found

The requested URL /nonexistent_page.php was not found on this server.

Apache/2.4.25 (Debian) Server at localhost Port 80
The <address> footer reveals exact Apache version, OS, hostname, and port. POC execution confirmed vulnerability with exit code 0 - successfully extracted version information from 404 error page body.
remediation:
1. Create a custom 404 error page that does not expose server information:
   - Create /var/www/html/error404.html without version details
   - Remove the <address> footer or replace with generic message

2. Configure Apache ErrorDocument directive:
   - Edit /etc/apache2/apache2.conf or site configuration
   - Add: ErrorDocument 404 /error404.html
   - Alternatively: ErrorDocument 404 "The requested resource was not found"

3. Disable automatic error page generation:
   - Set: ErrorDocument 404 default (Apache's default)
   - Or use: ErrorDocument 404 "Custom error message"

4. Test configuration:
   - Reload Apache: systemctl reload apache2
   - Verify 404 responses no longer contain version info: curl -i http://localhost/nonexistent

5. Update Apache version:
   - Current 2.4.25 (2016) is outdated
   - Update to latest 2.4.x: apt-get update && apt-get install apache2

6. Suppress other error pages:
   - Apply same custom error handling to 403, 500, etc.
   - Configure ServerTokens Prod (reduces header info)
   - Configure ServerSignature Off (removes signature from pages)
references:
CWE-200: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
OWASP: Information Disclosure
Apache Documentation: ErrorDocument Directive
Apache Security: Apache 2.4.25 End of Life (June 2018)
toolCallDescription: Document Apache version disclosure in 404 error page as a MEDIUM severity information disclosure vulnerability
